name: Paris Baguette
description:
Welcome to your neighbourhood bakery café where smiles are served daily.
Enjoy delicious pastries, warm bread, stunning cakes, and expertly brewed drinks while feeling right at home.
On every level, Paris Baguette strives to do their best to deliver the very best to you. Their certified bakers and baristas are brimming with talent and eager to share their perfectly crafted creations.
Paris Baguette strives to bring expertly crafted baked and brewed goods to their guests through a warm and welcoming bakery café experience that delivers joy to everyone.
Built for connection and community, they take their responsibility as a good neighbour to heart. Through the magic of baking, they are committed to giving back and making a real impact.

name: TGI Fridays
description: Famous for American classics, TGI Fridays serves fresh appetizers, juicy burgers and delicious desserts. Dine in with friends and enjoy the fun of sharing, as their portion is perfect to share. With the fun and friendly waiters and waitresses, T.G.I Friday’s has become the ultimate destination for diners looking for something distinctive and different.

name: Barbeque Nation
description:
Barbeque Nation has finally made its way to our shores, opening its first outlet in the heart of Bukit Bintang.
Located on Level 9, the establishment takes on the concept of DIY that allows diners to choose their favourite dishes from a wide range of buffet spreads featuring mouthwatering selections of meat and vegetarian delights. Apart from that, diners are spoilt for choice with a tantalising array of grilled skewers.

name: Hokkaido Baked Cheese Tart
description:
Originating from Hokkaido, our resident bakers worked with counterparts from Hokkaido, Japan to further improve the recipe of this baked pastry to ensure a uniqueness in taste and texture. The soft and creamy centre is made with a blend of three different types of cream, mascarpone and parmesan cheeses, piped into a crunchy shortcrust pastry base.
Tasting best when it is right out of the oven, the Hokkaido Baked Cheese Tart also taste awesome when chilled, giving you a smooth and refreshing experience. When frozen, the tart is alike a creamy cheesy ice cream. Try all the ways of eating it and decide which one you like best!

name: Baan Phadthai
description: Touted as the “House of Phad Thai” in Thailand, the award-winning Baan Phadthai specialises in the signature stir-fry dish that is made with secret 18-ingredient sauce. Expect a wide selection of great and authentic Thai dishes that will surely tantalise your taste buds.

name: Sulbing
description: Dessert Café Sulbing with the Nature of the Four Seasons

name: Potato Corner
description: The World’s Best Flavored French Fries since 1992! 💚 #PotatoCornerMY

name: MICHELANGELO’S RISTORANTE ITALIANO
description: This outlet provides mid-range Italian fine dining in a sophisticated setting. Here you can savor the upscale casual dining of authentic Italian menu and enjoy exotic cocktails. Set in rustic decor, Michelangelo’s is spacious but remains cozy with its warm lighting. Enjoy their great tasting ‘Spaghetti Marinara Sizzlelini’ and complete your meal with a glass of wine.

name: EL&N London
description:
EL&N is the leading Instagrammable café and lifestyle brand. Everything they make is irresistibly chic, pink perfection. Their products help customers create that picture perfect moment – every time.
EL&N stands for Eat, Live and Nourish. All that they create is informed by these 3 guiding touch points: The most delectable food and drink offering in a stunning setting, products for living a stylish life and a positive ethos to nourish your soul.
Pavilion Lifestyle /  Priority:Enjoy 10% off with a minimum spending of RM100 in a single receipt.(Click for more info)
Pavilion Luxe:Enjoy 15% off with a minimum spending of RM150 in a single receipt.(Click for more info)
Tourist Privileges:10% off any purchase or 20% off purchases with beverages.(Click for more info)
*Terms and conditions apply.

name: Tony Roma’s
description: Considered the pioneer of Baby Back Ribs, Tony Roma’s can now be found all over the world. At Tony Roma’s, they take pride in using the freshest greens, herbs, fruits, vegetables, meats  seafood for our salads and entrees. It’s part of a tradition that includes making dozens of items from scratch every day – like fire-roasted vegetables, oven-baked desserts, hand-mashed redskin potatoes with real cream, sauces, marinades, dressings and original steak and seafood toppings. To end the perfect meal, sink your teeth into the Raspberry Brownie Royale.

name: Haidilao Hot Pot
description:
Sichuan Haidilao Catering Co. Ltd was founded in 1994 and it began serving the worldwide popular Sichuan style Hot Pot gathering various regional influences and tastes along the way.
Since then, Haidilao has always dedicated to achieving the perfect blend of authentic traditional Chinese food- Hot Pot with the convenience of modern trend. And we would love to deliver the healthy Hot Pot culture all over the world.

name: Laem Charoen Thai Seafood
description:
Laem Charoen Seafood’s uniquesignature dish is a deep-fried seabass cooked with fish sauce until crisp andgolden. It is a simple dish, full of flavour and cooked from the heart usingonly the freshest ingredients available with Thai-style flavour and delicatecooking techniques.
Laem Charoen Seafood has grown tobecome one of the most loved seafood restaurants in Thailand with many branchesacross the country, attracting both foreigners and Thai customers alike.

name: Yu Yan
description:
Yu Yan Tea Factory was founded in 1904 and is currently located at Wuyi Huaxia City, Gaosuban, Wuyishan Street, Wuyishan City. Madam Fan Youmei, the current tea factory director, was born into a tea-oriented family, inheriting the traditional process of Wuyi rock tea. She adheres to the charcoal roasting technique to ensure the aroma and taste of the rock tea in the best performance.
Besides promoting the culture of tea, Yu Yan hopes that the worldwide tea consumer has the chance to recognize the classic art of tea. In the year 2005, Madam Yu Xi Hua (the daughter of Mdm. Fan) came to Malaysia to establish the Le Ye Xuan Dahongpao company and operated the YuYan Dahongpao tea shop on the Jalan Sultan in the capital Kuala Lumpur. Nowadays, the tea shop has promoted three major types of tea, Wuyi Rock Tea, Jianyang White Tea, and TongMuGuan Black Tea.

name: Tan Ngan Lo
description: Tan Ngan Lo medicated tea is a herbal mixture made with various of natural herbs. The unique formulation is especially effective in moderating health problems such as bad breaths, mouth ulcers, sore throats, coughs, flu, and lethargy. It also relieves stress brought about by work related pressure, lack of sleep, and unhealthy lifestyles.

name: Gindaco
description:
World-famous, piping hot takoyaki balls made with premium wheat flour and octopus filling with a choice of four variants – Original, Negidako, Cheese Mentaiko and Teritama. Original isGindaco’sflagship, and it is drizzled withGindaco’ssignature sauce and topped with dried seaweed and dancing bonito flakes.
Besides takoyakis,Gindacoalso serves Yakisoba – Japanese soba fried with cabbage, chicken slices, dried green seaweed and dancing bonito flakes. All Gindaco’s products are pork-free.

name: ROYCE’
description: ROYCE’ is a Japanese chocolate maker and confectioner based in Hokkaido, a utopia of mountains, sparkling water, fresh air – undoubtedly, home to only the finest of ingredients. ROYCE’ crafts confectioneries brimming with flavour and bursting with originality, using keenly selected ingredients from Japan and all around the world.Tourist Privilege:Free Pure Chocolate of any flavour worth RM52 with purchase of RM350 on regular items in a single receipt.(Click for more info)

name: Cold Stone Creamery
address: Lot P1.24.00, P1.25.01, P1.25.02, Level 1, Gourmet Emporium
description: Cold Stone Creameryoffers the Ultimate Ice Cream Experience. Ice Cream, Ice Cream Cakes, Shakes, and Smoothies the Way You Want It.

name: Mahnaz Food
description: Mahnaz Food is Malaysia’s largest chain of outlets offering dates, dry fruits, nuts, almond, juices and many other foods. We are a wholesale supplier with the best quality at the most affordable rates.

name: Starbucks Coffee (Level 3)
description: Carefully selecting the finest beans, Starbucks earned its’ name from serving high-quality coffee. From Espresso to Frappuccino to Teas, Starbucks offers great coffee and fresh food from morning till late. Order your favorite beverage and enjoy your scroll at the mall!

name: Dome Café
description: Renowned for its specialty coffee, every fine cup of DÔME coffee starts with high quality coffee beans. The finest Arabica beans are selected and roasted to perfection using the latest technologies to maximize freshness and flavour for the ultimate caffeine fix. DÔME Café is also known for its extensive range of Asian & Western dishes. Pizzas, pastas, wraps, salads, as well as the Chicken Pie, Nasi Lemak and Signature Espreski – part dessert, part drink – make up the repertoire of delicious food, great drinks and chill music ensconced in a warm, cosy café ambience. DÔME Café is the ideal spot to eat, meet, drink. Simply drop by for comfort food, coffee and conversation.

name: Burger King
description:
Every day, more than 11 million guests visit BURGER KING® restaurants around the world. And they do so because the restaurants are known for serving high-quality, great tasting, and affordable food. Founded in 1954, BURGER KING® is the second largest fast food hamburger chain in the world.
BURGER KING® commenced operations in Malaysia in 1997 with the opening of its first restaurant at Sungai Buloh Overhead Bridge. Today, Cosmo Restaurants Sdn Bhd operates more than 120 BURGER KING® restaurants in Malaysia where customers across the country can enjoy the great and healthy flame-grilled taste of Burger King products.
The original HOME OF THE WHOPPER®, the commitment to premium ingredients, signature recipes, and family-friendly dining experiences is what has defined the brand for more than 50 successful years.

name: Dragon-i Peking Duck
description: Inspired by the rich and diverse culinary offerings from China, especially from the regions of Shanghai, Szechuan, Beijing and Lanzhou, each delicacy in Dragon-i is prepared by highly-skilled chefs from mainland China using top quality ingredients to ensure authenticity in both presentation and taste. Savour the warmth of their signature dishes such as Xiao Long Bao (Shanghainese steamed meat dumplings) and La Mian (hand-pulled noodles).

name: Beryl’s
description:
Beryl’s uses only the highest quality cocoa beans from Ghana to make the best chocolate in Malaysia.
Heaven In Your Mouth with Beryl’s Fine Chocolate.

name: Sushi Zanmai
description: Sushi Zanmai is the genuine conveyor-belt sushi restaurant that provides more than 100 assortments of sushi and large varieties of cooked food that are authentically Japanese. Come and enjoy this well-loved sushi restaurant by families and young professionals.

name: Boost Juice Bars
description:
Australian juice bar phenomenon, Boost Juice Bars, promises to tickle Malaysian taste buds with the delicious smoothies that have made the brand a global success story. All products have been developed by a dedicated Boost nutritionist – and everything is at least 98% fat-free and free from any artificial  and . For those who are opting for healthier, fresh alternatives for a snack, head on to the Boost Juice Bars.
Pavilion Junior Privilege:10% off normal priced items from “Most Popular” drink menu.(Click for more info)

name: SIX by Saro
description: Saro is a luxury lounge bar in the heart of Kuala Lumpur. Located within the prestigious Pavilion Elite along the famous Bukit Bintang strip, it’s the ideal inner-city sanctum, where you can immerse yourself in rich surrounds and enjoy decadent cocktails whilst savouring tapas portioned culinary delights.

name: OCEAN TWE12VE
description:
OCEAN TWE12VE is a seafood restaurant conceptualized and operated by MICHELANGELO’S and launched in Pavilion KL. Their Western-style, aesthetically-plated seafood is guaranteed to appeal to the senses.
Versatile starters are ideal for sharing, or even as a main dish – enjoy them with their eclectic and exciting mocktails and cocktails. Try pairing the fresh oysters, live mussels, rare-seared yellowfin tuna, and bacalao (salted cod carpaccio) with a glass of Champagne or Pinot Grigio for a satisfying treat!
Or indulge in their Lobster Bisque, made with authentic Canadian lobster meat, accompanied by a glass of Chardonnay or Kombucha.
Overwhelmed by the wide choice of seafood? Just opt for the Spice-Grilled Lamb Rack, Oven-Baked Beef Rib, or Grilled Chicken with their special chilli-lime sauce.

name: CHAGEE
description: Originated from Yunnan China in November 2017, CHAGEE is one of the earliest regional teahouse chain that positions itself as the purveyor of Original Tea Leaf of the Chinese Culture.

name: Tealive Plus
description: Indulge in gourmet selections that are specially-crafted to pair with the unique drinks that can only be found in Tealive Plus, the first premium Tealive concept store in Pavilion KL.

name: ParaThai
description: Experience the intensity of the spices and the fragrance of fresh herbs laced and lavished in each dish at ParaThai. Led by Chef Bunmee and his expert team of Thai nationals, the culinary team stays true to the culinary culture and ancient flavours, offering guests an elaborate menu where they will be spoilt with choices. Expect to savour a list of dishes prepared using ancient recipes with a focus on flavours and freshness.

name: Rollti
description:
Rollti – a rolled roti canai. A handheld product with all the yumminess of a traditional Roti Canai wrapped in fantastic flavour profiles from around Malaysia while combining fresh proteins and vegetables.
Rollti is Malaysia No.1 best tasting Roti Canai Wrap!

name: Yayoi Japanese Teishoku Restaurant
description: YAYOI prepares teishoku with a healthy balance of dishes on a single tray. These set meals contain freshly-cooked rice, the staple food of the Japanese people, accompanied by miso soup and other main and side dishes. YAYOI continues the efforts to promote the unique styles and wisdom of Japanese food culture to the world through its teishoku dishes. YAYOI, taking traditional Japanese cuisine into the world and the future.

name: The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf (Level 3)
description: Coffee Bean offers over 22 varieties of coffee and 20 kinds of tea. Its’ signature drink is the Original Ice Blend which are available in Mocha, Caramel, Hazelnut, etc. Coffee Bean’s dedication is to excellence and quality, promising a cup of great coffee. Enjoy the smooth creamy coffee and some pastries to satisfy the sweet tooth.

name: Grand Imperial Seafood Hotpot & BBQ
description: The new Grand Imperial Seafood Hotpot & BBQ located in Pavilion Elite Shopping Mall (9th floor).Grand Imperial’s highly skillful and experienced chefs are very particular with details. From the selection of ingredients, preparation and cooking, they’re committed in providing customers with the highest quality of food.

name: Samy & Min Bak Kut Teh
description:
Tourist Privilege:10% OFF total bill with purchase of RM50 and above in a single receipt(Click for more info)
Pavilion Lifestyle, Priority, Luxe Privilege:10% off total bill with purchase of RM50 and above in a single receipt(Click for more info)
Pavilion Junior Privilege:10% off total bill with purchase of RM50 and above in a single receipt(Click for more info)
Non-halal
Bak Kut Teh is popularly associated with Klang, and locals actually believed the place to be the origin of Bak Kut Teh as recipes and measurements are passed down from generations, churning out the best taste and quality of Bak Kut Teh.
Samy & Min Bak Kut Teh is a brand and name on it’s own that has a vast reputation in the Bak Kut Teh field in Klang. They maintain the quality and traditions of their Bak Kut Teh based on 3 main pillars – good rice, good soup and good pork. Samy & Min Bak Kut Teh has more than 25 years worth of Bak Kut Teh legacy and prides for their strict recipes and ingredients’ freshness to uphold the taste and quality of what they serve – rich broth and tenderly fresh meat.
Specialty: 25 Years Of Bak Kut Teh Legacy
The beauty of having a meal in Samy & Min at Pavilion KL is a comfortable spacious space that’s well eqiupped air-conditioned, together with an outdoor view. In terms of menu selection, you are able to decide and pick from any of the 10 sections of the meat that ranges from pork ribs to pork bend. It’s like Bak Kut Teh ala tapas version.If you don’t have the time to travel all the way to Klang but still need to fulfill your Samy & Min Bak Kut Teh cravings, obviously this place is for you.
Meaty Bite: Meat To Success
‘Samy & Min Big Bone’ dish is also one to look out for as it is one of the top Klang favourites for the balanced texture of tender meat and bouncy gelatine.One of the main pillars – GOOD MEAT is shown through the freshness of the meat and it a priority here at Samy & Min as you can actually see and taste the difference. At Samy & Min Bak Kut Teh, the ingredients are freshly made every morning to give a smooth and tender meat texture that falls of the bones.
Balanced Bite: The-Good-Duo‘Samy & Min Pork Bend’ is the hot seller dish as it contains part that are rare and limited. The texture of the meat is moist and has a nice tendon-like bite to the gelatin.The other pillar – GOOD SOUP is the broth that Samy & Min uses in their entire menu. The broth is thicker than your usual Bak Kut Teh soup as it churns up the prime essence and flavours. With the strong and balanced broth, it goes exceptionally well with the special fragrant scallion rice that is their last pillar – GOOD RICE.
Unique Bite: The Palate Teaser
To complete the Samy & Min Bak Kut Teh experience, order up their side dishes that is only available in their Pavilion KL outlet. The abalone dish here has a chewy texture and sweet taste – a great palate teaser before diving in the actual Bak Kut Teh dishes. Other side dishes available would be deep-fried beancurd in broth, juicy and succulent mushrooms and perfectly fried egg with onion.

name: TANYU 探鱼
description: TANYU specialises in Chongqing grilled fish in over 70 major cities in Asia with more than 300 outlets to date. Well known for its signature Grilled Fish with Fresh Green Pepper, TANYU is landing its first flagship store in Malaysia at Pavilion Kuala Lumpur. In order to cater to the diverse tastes of local Malaysians, TANYU makes use of a variety of cooking methods and offers 8 kinds of grilled fish flavors ranging from mala, sourish spicy, to savory and more.

name: Koong Woh Tong
description:
Koong Woh Tong’s authentic Herbal Jelly or “Guiling Gao” is made with more than 20 types of the finest Chinese traditional herbs. The healing attributes of our Herbal Jelly lies in the processed using an age-old secret recipe. The herbs are boiled more than 9 hours to jelly like texture, giving it our superior quality signature taste.
Koong Woh Tong’s authentic Herbal Jelly or “Guiling Gao” is made with more than 20 types of the finest Chinese traditional herbs. The healing attributes of our Herbal Jelly lies in the processed using an age-old secret recipe. The herbs are boiled more than 9 hours to jelly like texture, giving it our superior quality signature taste.
Our products are non-alcoholic, non-fat and is suitable for people of all ages and vegetarians as well. Herbal Jelly can detoxify body, nourishes the skin, relieve indigestions, reduce body heat and much more.
Our products are non-alcoholic, non-fat and is suitable for people of all ages and vegetarians as well. Herbal Jelly can detoxify body, nourishes the skin, relieve indigestions, reduce body heat and much more.

name: Shu Guo Yin Xiang Hotpot
description: Shu Guo Yin Xiang Hotpot is a chain of hot pot restaurants from Sichuan, China founded in Chengdu, Sichuan, China. Indulge in an authentic hotpot experience with their specialty hotpot bases and tuck into a variety of dishes, prepared using fresh ingredients.

name: Starbucks Coffee (Level 6)
description: Carefully selecting the finest beans, Starbucks earned its’ name from serving high-quality coffee. From Espresso to Frappuccino to Teas, Starbucks offers great coffee and fresh food from morning till late. Order your favorite beverage and enjoy your scroll at the mall!

name: Din Tai Fung
description:
Applicable for dine-in only; subjected to availability and other terms & conditions.(Click for more info)
#DDD – #DinnerDateDestination featuring Din Tai Fung, Level 6
A well-established player in the classic Taiwanese restaurant scene since 1972 – the Michelin-starred Din Tai Fung has always been at top of mind for their succulent soup dumplings (also known as ‘xiao long bao’). Apart from their delicious staple noodles and rice dishes, in this segment, we’re focusing on their out-of-the-norm savoury and sweet dishes that are absolutely taste-worthy to tantalise your tastebuds.

Special Features: Oriental Lattice with A Modern Twist
In Din Tai Fung, the interior is inspired by ancient Chinese mansions with wooden lattice designs that represents eternal love. It’s then complemented by a minimalist take on the wall-imprinted Chinese drawers that gives the eatery a modern romantic oriental look and feel while tucking into delectable Taiwanese dishes with mild Shanghainese influence. Order a variety of dishes to try and share during your dinner date, just like how the Taiwanese does it.

Spicy Bite: The Wake Up Appetiser
If you’re a fan of spicy dishes, the Spicy Sichuan Chicken dish is bound to have you on your feet with its chilled, poached and tender chicken drenched in hot and mildly sweet Sichuan pepper blend, alongside crunchy peanuts and sesame to awaken your tastebuds.To simmer down the heat, order up glasses of wine that are exclusively available in Pavilion KL that is a match made in heaven with spicy treats.

Soupy Bite: 18 Perfect Golden Folds
The pork ‘xiao long bao’ in Din Tai Fung is the all-time favourite of many loyal patrons. If you take a peek into the open kitchen, observe how skilled chefs are carefully shaping the little soup-filled dumplings with consistent quality of 21g and 18 golden folds to reach the optimum level of soup encasing.
We were taught how to properly eat the infamous ‘xiao long bao’. First, dress the ginger with one dash of soy sauce and three dashes of vinegar that is imported from Taiwan. Then, drink the soup of the ‘xiao long bao’, dip it in the sauce, top with ginger and ascend to food-dumpling-heaven.

Refreshing Swig: A Zesty Gulp
Din Tai Fung houses the Sparkling Roselle drink using Roselle, a hibiscus species herb that is known for its mildly sweet and tangy natural flavours and blood circulation benefits. The Sparking Roselle drink is divine especially when pairing with Din Tai Fung’s delicacies.

Noodle Bite: A Light Slurp
Din Tai Fung serves the Minced Pork In Bean Sauce Dry Noodles (also known as ‘Zha Jiang Mian’) that is different than any other. Its lighter version follows Taiwanese tastebuds for a cleaner taste of the ingredients. The dish is a mixture of different elements that brings different delight textures such as minced pork, tofu and edamame that ties the whole dish together.

Rice Bite: The DTF Signature
Pork Chop Fried Rice is Din Tai Fung’s signature dish that uses Japanese rice grains coated with ‘kampung egg’ for a more savoury and satisfying bite, topped with premium pork chop. This has a Japanese element as Taiwan was colonised by Japan for 50 years. It’s especially evident through its use of Japanese-inspired ingredients and great customer services.

Crunchy Bite: The Taiwanese Starter
The Din Tai Fung house special – Oriental Salad is a Taiwanese staple starter dish that cleanses the palate with its zesty flavours and crunchy textures from a mixture of sea kelp, glass noodles, bean sprouts and dry bean curds with a splash of vinegar serve chilled.

Creamy Bite: Best of Two Worlds
A hidden gem that you can rarely find in other restaurants would be would be the super creamy and sticky dessert – Yam Paste Dessert. To get the optimum natural sweetness, this unique and delectable treat is pretty tricky to make as it requires constant stirring by hand for one hour each for two separate components – yam paste and pumpkin paste.

Chocolaty Bite: Wrapped Goodness
Din Tai Fung takes an unconventional twist on its signature “xiao long bao”, bringing you chocolate “xiao long bao” that encapsulates a chewy chocolate mochi filled with warm dark chocolate that’ll take you on a surprise sweet journey.

name: Yang Guo Fu Mala Tang
description: YangGuoFu specialises in a popular Sichuan dish, Malatang. Well known for its yummy soup with natural ingredients, their soup consists of Classic Beef Bone Broth Malatang, Sweet & Sour Tomato Soup Malatang and Mellow Malaban. Choose from a wide range of over 60 fresh ingredients including meat, seafood, vegetables, noodles, and specialty items to create your ultimate bowl of Malatang.

name: Krispy Kreme Doughnut
description:
Krispy Kreme specialised in doughnuts and coffee since 1937. All Krispy Kreme stores offer its signature Original Glazed ® doughnuts as well as 18 core varieties including iced, oreo and chocolate doughnuts. Their product may be special and unique – but it’s our people who make the difference. Every month they do their best to introduce something fantastic so that they can help bring some joy to your day!

Pavilion Junior Privilege:One (1) Vitakids and an assorted doughnut for RM6.30(Click for more info)

name: Gong Cha
description:
The term “Gong Cha” is translated as the ancient act of offering tea to royalty, such as the Emperor of China. In the same way, Gong Cha hopes to offer only the best quality tea to everyone around the world- because you, our customer, is like royalty to us!
Gong Cha is an international bubble tea chain that originated from Kaohsiung, Taiwan in 2006, and since 2009, has swept Malaysia’s neighbouring countries – Singapore, Hong Kong, China, Macau and the Philippines – by storm. To date, Gong Cha is the fastest growing brand and has further expanded internationally to South Korea, Japan, USA, Canada and other countries, with more than 1,500 stores worldwide. Gong Cha’s story is one that roots itself as one of the most reliable providers of quality tea in the world.

name: Dar Soo Vegetarian Cuisine
description: Vegetarian restaurant serving dishes with vegetables, soya bean, tauhu, and more.

name: DayOne DayOne Noodles
description: We proudly present Chew-chew Noodles. Handmade byprofessional noodle-makers and tailored by noodles making machines with specialspecifications, Chew-chew Noodles use free-range eggs and strong flour, with nopreservatives and processed products. We use the recipes that have been handeddown only to our chefs through the generations, the healthy sauces made fromtraditional lard dregs and the spices made of chopped scallion. Each bowl ofChew-chew Noodles will bring back the memories of the quality time you have hadwith your family.

name: Oriental Kopi
description: Oriental Kopi prides itself in serving mouthwatering NanYang cuisine that is borne of age-old recipes and traditions. Signature dishes include Oriental Coffee, Portuguese EggTart & Polo Bun.

name: Oloiya
description: Savour the traditional Chinese treat called ‘bak kua’ (dried meat in Hokkien)!  Freshly barbequed from the oven, it is much healthier to enjoy this way. Flavors range from pork, chicken and lobster. It comes in the form of bacon, medallion, bite size or floss. It is especially popular during the Chinese New Year period.

name: Shojikiya
description:
Shojikiya offers a variety of food products from chocolates, chips, crackers, candy, beverages, and ice cream including canned foods, sauces and dressing, frozen foods and wines that are imported from Japan. We have an extensive range for you to choose from and we are always bringing in new and exotic products to delight you and your family.
Check out our store now!

name: Fei Fei Crab Restaurant
description:
The most popular crab restaurant in KL There are many special and innovative crab dishes here. Founded in 2008.
Pavilion Lifestyle, Priority, and Luxe:Enjoy 10% off on the total bill.(Click here for more)

name: RasaTea House
description: At RasaTea House, we invite you to savor our unique fusion cuisine, blending the vibrant flavors of Nyonya (Peranakan) culinary traditions with the elegance of Western cuisine. Our menu features a delightful mix of British and Nyonya influences, showcasing a harmonious blend of Chinese and Malay flavors with classic Western dishes. Experience the best of both worlds in a culinary journey that pays homage to the rich, diverse heritage of the Baba Nyonya.

name: Da On Fine Korean Cuisine
description: Da On represents the modern facets of Korean cuisine, from the interior concept and refined service to its contemporary food presentation. The cuisine remains authentic. Fancy a mildly spiced Kim Chi ice cream? How about Mul Naeng Myeon (Cold Noodles) – chewy, thread-thin buckwheat noodles cooked with apple and pear slices, hard-boiled egg, sliced beef, radish and cucumber? Let Da On sweep you away with its contemporary ambiance, cordial service and sumptuous specialties.

name: Serai @ Pavilion KL
description:
Serai@Pavilion KL is a home-grown restaurant created by a family whose passion is to share gastronomical delights.
Established in 1990, Serai devotedly brings years of culinary experience to your plate. The carefully curated menu features local delicacies such as Nasi Kerabu with tender ayam percik and steamed fish doused in spicy and tangy lime sauce, co-existing with Western favourites such as the succulent Moroccan Lamb Shank and Gourmet Beef Burger. End your meal on a sweet note with charming home-made desserts like the ever popular Berry Pavlova.
Tourist Privilege:10% discount with RM100 minimum spend.(Click for more info)
*Pavilion Privileges Member Card/Mobile App/Pavillion Hotel KL — Key Access Card/Banyan Tree Hotel KL – Key Access Card must be presented during payment.

name: Herbal Farmer
description: Herbal Farmer, founded in 2017. ‘Herbal’ with ‘Farmer’ can be associate that healthcare is accumulated over time, just like the harvest of a farmer’s hard work every day. Herbal Farmer modernize the traditional industries, makes traditional images into textures, integrates the culture and characteristics of the brand, and provides brand-new and fashionable Chinese herbal products and shopping experience.

name: Lavender
description: Enjoy a selection of bread and pastries in Lavender, from Hong Kong Style Bun to Pineapple Tarts. All products are freshly baked from the hot oven to give you the buttery aroma. Be spoiled by the wide variety of bakery food you can find here – be it for a quick breakfast or tea time snack!

name: Yuan Lao Si Hotpot
description:
At Yuanlaosi Hotpot, we are committed to “putting your experience” first.
As we continue to study and improve the food and services, the brand adheres to quality and fresh foods, innovative ingredients in our recipe with personalized services. Yuanlaosi’s goal is to provide the best taste and experience for all consumers.

name: Fuiyoh! It’s Uncle Roger
description: Haiyaa! Uncle Roger finally open restaurant, and of course got fried rice. You think Uncle Roger open place without fried rice? So silly! Niece and nephew, come try, or you’ll make Uncle Roger so disappointed!

name: Nanyang Cafe
description: A Malaysia born culinary brand, a fusion interpretation of Nanyang delicacies. Signature favourites include Hong Kong Style Wanton Noodles, Freshly Baked Polo Bun, Nanyang Coffee & Tea. Offers an all-day dining experience in casual and relax ambience.

name: Rakuzen
description: Rakuzen is committed to providing genuine Japanese food at affordable prices, in cosy ambience, such that patrons of all levels and ages can enjoy dining in a warm, friendly, welcoming & homely environment. The menu provides a wide selection of sushi, sashimi and range from seasonal dishes to exclusive personalized omakase sets, to give valued patrons a very unique Rakuzen dining experience.
